message.content: This question requires knowledge of how birds regulate their body temperature. Birds are endothermic animals, meaning they can generate and maintain their own body heat. However, they are unable to control the temperature of their blood independently of their environment. So, if a bird is exposed to extreme hot or cold temperatures, it will find difficulty in regulating its body heat and maintaining a stable internal temperature. Option (A) and (B) are incorrect because birds cannot intentionally chill or warm their blood. Option (C) is incorrect because although birds can adjust their body temperature to some extent, they are not able to regulate their blood temperature independently.
